snippet: A young man who sued two officers and New York City claiming police brutality was ordered to pay the city’s legal fees for making “obviously fictitious allegations,” a judge wrote.
abstract: Andrew Abeyta, Columbia University graduate who sued two officers and New York City claiming police brutality, is ordered to pay city’s legal fees, roughly $212,000, for making what a judge deemed to be false claims.
lead_paragraph: A young man who sued two officers and New York City claiming police brutality was ordered to pay the city’s legal fees for making “obviously fictitious allegations,” a judge wrote.

headline.main: Plaintiff in Police Lawsuit Is Ordered to Pay New York City’s Legal Fees
headline.print_headline: Man to Pay New York’s Legal Fees in Suit
